title: Strange though it might sound, we'll miss Brexit when it's gone
text:
If there's one thing that plenty of Remainers and Leavers agree on, is that they're bored out of their minds with Brexit; increasingly they acknowledge that David Cameron should never have initiated the whole sorry exercise, and retrospectively they accept that both referendum campaigns were flawed, with Remainers peddling fear and Leavers appealing to the lesser angels of voters' natures. After all this, and after all the family spats, the friendship-ending arguments and the Twitter lynchings, they're glad that any sort of resolution is in sight, so we can get on with our lives.

And yet it's possible we'll come to miss this most contentious of subjects and tempestuous of eras, and certainly...
description: If there's one thing that plenty of Remainers and Leavers agree on, is that they're bored out of their minds with Brexit;
